relation: Licensed Registered Professional Nurses or Licensed Practical/Vocational Nurses or the international equivalent.
Students enrolled full time in an accredited school of nursing (proof of enrollment required)
Persons affiliated with the healthcare industry who support the goals of ANAC but do not meet the requirements for another category of membership

Licensed Registered Nurses or Licensed Practical/Vocational Nurses or the international equivalent. To qualify for retired dues, you must have been an ANAC member for at least 5 years prior to your application for retired dues. Proof of age over the federal retirement age is required.
Only available to nurses residing and working in a low or lower middle income country, as classified by the World Bank.
pageTitle: Membership General Information - Association of Nurses in AIDS Care
textBeforeTable: What types of individual memberships are available?   The opportunity to participate on the national and local levels in activities which help shape the response of nurses to the HIV epidemic through membership in one of many local ANAC chapters. Eligibility for ANAC Clinical Achievement Awards; Reduced rate on ANAC’s core curriculum on HIV nursing; Discounted rate on the HIV/AIDS certification exam; Discounted rate for the ANAC Annual Conference; Automatic subscription to JANAC (the Journal of ANAC, published by Elsevier) ANAC membership connects you to a network of professional nurses on the front lines of HIV work.  In addition to joining this impressive network of more than 2,200 professionals with similar goals and interests, you will enjoy the following benefits as an ANAC member: What are the benefits of ANAC Membership? } $('#' + replyFormID).toggle(); function showReplyForm(replyFormID){
textAfterTable: All new and expired ANAC memberships will be effective on the day dues are received and last for 12 months for a one year membership, 24 months for a two year membership or 36 months for a three year membership.    Home | Back to Top Association of Nurses in AIDS Care 3538 Ridgewood Road, Akron, Ohio 44333-3122 tel: 800.260.6780 (toll free) 330.670.0101 (phone) fax: 330.670.0109 email: anac@anacnet.org
